Title.evidence: Background: We carried out a study to assess the efficacy of tranexamic acid in preventing scar tissue in the craniectomy area in rats.

Trial_Design.evidence: Our study consisted of control and tranexamic acid groups with 10 subjects each.

Intervention.evidence: In the controls, the pads were soaked with saline and in the tranexamic acid group the pads were soaked with 30 mg/kg tranexamic acid.

Objective.evidence: We carried out a study to assess the efficacy of tranexamic acid in preventing scar tissue in the craniectomy area in rats.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The degree of scar formation was evaluated pathologically and by electron microscopy.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Our study consisted of control and tranexamic acid groups with 10 subjects each.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The outcomes demonstrated that no adhesions were present in the rats of the Tranexamic acid group, whereas the control group exhibited severe scar tissue [eight of ten rats (80%)] with adhesions.
